item.title: EHighwayLevel
item.description:
From Frank.Vi...@googlemail.com on August 02, 2010 11:50:30
Thought a bit about pro's and cons of using Enum for the highway level tag.
In my opinion we should use a whitelist of strings instead of the enum for importing the routing graph. The advantage of not using enums is that we don't need any changes inside the code for configuring the import. The highway level whitlist could be specified in a config file and no according enum must be created (saves work and removes redundancy). The same argument holds for EHighwayLevel2Speed. Here we could map strings to average speed instead of mapping enums to average speed.
What do you think about this?
Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=32
